text: Hi <@U010SKPP7CJ> I’ve attached some resources I’ve pulled together on COVID-19 response for health facilities, health workers, and recommendations for national level response

elements.text: I’ve attached some resources I’ve pulled together on COVID-19 response for health facilities, health workers, and recommendations for national level response

text:
Hey <@U0107JERE9L>  I understand the situation regarding connection and  for what <@U010H9HHT4M>  and <@U010B22ESES> are working on is crucial to have the format in pdf and vedio as it is the go to training for the HCP and Non clinical volunteers.
My idea is slightly diffent as it is not a training material but rather a scientific article where the health care professionals will always have to look for an update. They will not have time to read on different sources and hence we could potentially give them analyzed/synthesized version of the main suggestion or protocols.There is scientific information frequently coming out
Also we would ask them/ the association I mentioned to contribute on the local context and their findings which could be beneficial for other African countries and viserversa <@U0107A7161E>  what do you think for our group to  be not only a source for how to form a responsive team but  also scientific go to open source? 
We have an international starting point but will need to populate it in the local contexts and easily accessible hence why I proposed app / website or some sort of format that could also allow us to receive information from the user( interactive)

If all of you agree then can we  put it as a new moonshine project ?#proj- scientific Article-synthesizer and see its traction. I truly believe it will be beneficial

<@U010H9HHT4M> still awaiting for the training modules <@U011B8Y6N8N>  has included a list of sources that you can look at as additional information.
I am not sure if you have  included a training on intubation as a module  because I believe most of the fatalities in the ICU is improper intubation of the patient that lead to their deaths.
Correct me if If I am wrong but nurses have better practice than most doctors :grimacing::thinking_face: hence it would be serious issue when doctors/ nurses especially those one who are not working in the emergency starts handling patients and we assume they know how to do it. 
Hence I think it would great if you have included this training and also practical training for the HCP.
